subject: Marketing
title: Persuasion vs Manipulation
description: A quick win: understand Persuasion vs Manipulation.

hook.text: A salesman highlights real benefits. Another hides the cancel button. Both persuade.

buildup.text: Persuasion and manipulation sit on a spectrum. The difference is intent and transparency.

discovery.text: Ethical persuasion helps people decide well. Manipulation exploits their weaknesses.

twist.text: The line isn't always clear. A well-designed nudge can feel like manipulation to some.

climax.text: The test: would the customer still choose you if they knew everything you know?

punchline.text: If you'd hide it, don't do it.

quiz.question: What separates ethical persuasion from manipulation?
options: Intent and transparency toward the audience
The amount of money spent on the campaign
Whether the product is sold online or in stores
